definition: deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...

sentences.english: The implication was that there was no meaningful shortfall in client funds.
sentences.chinese: 言下之意是客户资金不存在真正意义上的亏空。

sentences.english: Our education deficit is too wide to ignore.
sentences.chinese: 我们的教育亏空太大，不容忽视。

sentences.english: The company had a deficit of＄3000.
Getting rid of the tax concessions for housing would help both control the deficit and speed up rebalancing.
sentences.chinese: 取消对房屋税收的妥协会有助于控制亏空和加速平衡。

sentences.english: Time to take a more welcoming look at the national deficit commission? I think so.
sentences.chinese: 是时候正视我们全国的赤字亏空了。

definition: income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
government repository/state provincial warehouse (esp. during Qing dynasty)
to shift (funds)/to (legitimately) take funds set aside for one purpose in order to use them for another/to embezzle/to misappropriate
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
